p:
The study in Section 2.1 uses 28 models from the CMIP phase 5 project (list in the legend of Fig.Â 1), downloaded from http://cmip-pcmdi.llnl.gov/cmip5/availability.html. Details of the models and data used are available at http://cmip-pcmdi.llnl.gov/cmip5/guide_to_cmip5.html. Standalone Community Atmosphere Model version 5.1 (CAM 5.1)
44 is used for rest of the study, which is the atmospheric component of Community Earth System Model (CESM). CESM is a coupled climate model, developed at the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR). Details of the NCAR CAM model are available at http://www.cesm.ucar.edu/models/cesm1.0/cam/docs/description/cam5_desc.pdf.
